body_html: Probably - I suspect that decreasing the tolerance in the asserts (from 1e-3 to a smaller number) would cause the test to fail, although I don't know if there is a testing convention in place for tolerance. Is there a reason 1e-3 was chosen in the first place, or is that a default value? These tests use numerical approximations, right? So at some point a low enough tolerance will always cause a failure.

body: Probably - I suspect that decreasing the tolerance in the asserts (from 1e-3 to a smaller number) would cause the test to fail, although I don't know if there is a testing convention in place for tolerance. Is there a reason 1e-3 was chosen in the first place, or is that a default value? These tests use numerical approximations, right? So at some point a low enough tolerance will always cause a failure.
